did.unittitle: J. Walter Thompson Company. New York Office. Research Department records 1923-1986 and undated
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: The J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT), founded in 1864, is one of the oldest and largest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. The Research Department was responsible for undertaking market research projects and disseminating research information, primarily for JWT's New York Office. The Research Department Records contain market research reports and other studies conducted for JWT. Includes some reports outsourced to a research firm, ASI Market Research, Inc. Research reports include television commercial studies; consumer opinion polls; product-specific studies; and market demographic reports including small town/rural markets; newspaper and magazine circulation; and African American consumer behavior. Clients represented include Chesebrough-Pond's, Coca-Cola, Kodak, Ford, Kellogg's, Kraft, and Rustenburg Platinum Mines. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: However, certain original reports are closed to researchers for preservation concerns. Use Copies are available in collection.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], J. Walter Thompson Company. New York Office. Research Department Records, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company. New York Office. Research Department Records were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as gifts in 1987 and 1993.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions 790814A, 820210, 821118, 830516, 860611B, 870206B, 93-057 were merged into one collection, described in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT), founded in 1864, is one of the oldest and largest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. The Research Department was responsible for undertaking market research projects and disseminating research information, primarily for JWT's New York Office.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Research Department Records contain market research reports and other studies conducted for JWT. Includes some reports outsourced to a research firm, ASI Market Research, Inc. Research reports include television commercial studies; consumer opinion polls; product-specific studies; and market demographic reports including small town/rural markets; newspaper and magazine circulation; and African-American consumer behavior. Clients represented include Chesebrough-Pond's, Coca-Cola, Kodak, Ford, Kellogg's, Kraft, and Rustenburg Platinum Mines.

arrangement.head: Collection Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection has been arranged into three series: the Account Files Series, the Reports Series, and the Oversize Materials Series. The Account Files Series contains market research reports and other studies conducted for specific JWT clients. The Reports Series contains reports and market research presentations not associated with a specific client. The Oversize Materials Series includes client-specific reports removed from the Account Files Series.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following Hartman Center of the J. Walter Thompson Company Archives:

extref.emph: Advertising and Marketing Intelligence Database Records
Detroit Office Goldfarb Consultants Ford Research Reports

scopecontent.p: Contains market research reports and other studies conducted for specific JWT clients. Includes television commercial studies for several clients, with breakdowns of age, income, viewing habits and product preferences among television commercial viewers from the 1980s. Also includes short reports of consumer opinion on particular products, including the Pond's Your Skin 'Dies' A Little campaign. Original folder titles were maintained and items were arranged alphabetically. Television commercial studies are organized by commercial format.

did.unittitle: Diet Coke, television commercial studies, circa 1986
Ford Tempo, television commercial studies, circa 1986
Kellogg's Bran Flakes, television commercial studies, circa 1986
[Kraft, television commercial studies, circa 1986: removed to Oversize Materials]
Pond's, interviews for Your Skin 'Dies' a Little Campaign, undated
Report on American Jewelers' Attitudes and Habits, 1977 May
Study of the American Consumer Market for Platinum, 1977 Nov.

scopecontent.p: Series contains reports and market research presentations not associated with a specific client. Some reports from the 1920s and 1930s account for lifestyles in rural markets in New York and Indiana. Series also includes television commercial studies performed by ASI Market Research, Inc. detailing viewers' demographic information, viewing habits and product preferences in several regions in California and the Midwest. Items are divided into Open Files and Restricted Files subseries, and arranged alphabetically by title.

accessrestrict.p: Restriction on Access: Originals of certain reports have been closed to researchers for preservation concerns. Use Copies are available in the collection.

scopecontent.p: Subseries includes Use Copies of materials held in the Restricted Files subseries.

scopecontent.p: Subseries contains original reports from the 1920s-1930s. Includes some photographs of small towns, townspeople and farmers in New York and Indiana.

accessrestrict.p: Restrictions on access: originals restricted for preservation purposes. Use Copies available in collection.
